issue.title: GPU laser and ogre test failures with ATI

content.raw:
Right, not so easy, in fact, probably ugly to do in all kinds of our tests. We can run the Ogre tests individually and export the log only for it.

We can always use chroot yes, the problem is that graphic acceleration requires, to work fine, that the chroot and the real system to have exactly the same versions on the full X related software. So Precise chroot gpu tests are not going to work fine on a Trusty real host system.
content.html:
Right, not so easy, in fact, probably ugly to do in all kinds of our tests. We can run the Ogre tests individually and export the log only for it.

We can always use chroot yes, the problem is that graphic acceleration requires, to work fine, that the chroot and the real system to have exactly the same versions on the full X related software. So Precise chroot gpu tests are not going to work fine on a Trusty real host system.
